title: Israeli strike kills 19 in Gaza humanitarian area, health officials say
content: Gazan authorities reported deaths after missiles struck Mawasi, a safe zone designated for displaced people. The IDF said it was targeting Hamas militants.
summary: Gazan authorities reported deaths after missiles struck Mawasi, a safe zone designated for displaced people. The IDF said it was targeting Hamas militants.

title: U.S. accuses Iran of sending ballistic missiles to Russia
content: Tehran has sent missiles to Russia, Secretary of State Antony Blinken said, escalating the conflict in Ukraine and exacerbating tensions with the West.
summary: Tehran has sent missiles to Russia, Secretary of State Antony Blinken said, escalating the conflict in Ukraine and exacerbating tensions with the West.

title: U.S. demands IDF change West Bank operations after American’s killing
content: Secretary of State Antony Blinken’s comments were the strongest yet from a U.S. official after the Israeli military said it was “highly likely” it “unintentionally” killed Aysenur Eygi.
summary: Secretary of State Antony Blinken’s comments were the strongest yet from a U.S. official after the Israeli military said it was “highly likely” it “unintentionally” killed Aysenur Eygi.

title: Man accused of setting Olympic runner on fire also dies of burns, hospital says
content: A hospital in Kenya said Dickson Ndiema, the ex-boyfriend of runner Rebecca Cheptegei, died of burns sustained during his alleged fire attack after the Paris Olympics.
summary: A hospital in Kenya said Dickson Ndiema, the ex-boyfriend of runner Rebecca Cheptegei, died of burns sustained during his alleged fire attack after the Paris Olympics.

title: Apple, Google must pay billions in back taxes and fines, E.U. court rules
content: The European Court of Justice said Apple must repay about $14.35 billion after reaping illegal tax benefits in Ireland and backed a $2.65 billion antitrust fine on Google.
summary: The European Court of Justice said Apple must repay about $14.35 billion after reaping illegal tax benefits in Ireland and backed a $2.65 billion antitrust fine on Google.

title: Dozens dead after Typhoon Yagi makes landfall in Vietnam
content: Dozens of people were dead or missing after Typhoon Yagi struck, triggering heavy rains and landslides. A steel bridge collapsed as a result of the flooding.
summary: Dozens of people were dead or missing after Typhoon Yagi struck, triggering heavy rains and landslides. A steel bridge collapsed as a result of the flooding.

title: Ukraine launches largest drone attack yet on Moscow, killing 1, Russia says
content: Russia’s Defense Ministry said at least 140 drones were launched against targets across the country but most were shot down, including 14 in Moscow itself.
summary: Russia’s Defense Ministry said at least 140 drones were launched against targets across the country but most were shot down, including 14 in Moscow itself.

title: Australia plans social media minimum age, citing mental health concerns
content: The government is considering a minimum age of between 14 and 16 for using apps without parental permission, but some experts warn of harmful consequences.
summary: The government is considering a minimum age of between 14 and 16 for using apps without parental permission, but some experts warn of harmful consequences.

title: As Trump looms, Ukraine turns to its evangelicals to woo the Republicans
content: Ukraine has the largest evangelical community in Europe and its outreach to Republicans could prove crucial in securing additional American aid.
summary: Ukraine has the largest evangelical community in Europe and its outreach to Republicans could prove crucial in securing additional American aid.

title: What is ecocide and could it become an international crime like genocide?
content: Vanuatu, Fiji and Samoa — island nations particularly vulnerable to climate change — asked the International Criminal Court to make the destruction of ecosystems a crime.
summary: Vanuatu, Fiji and Samoa — island nations particularly vulnerable to climate change — asked the International Criminal Court to make the destruction of ecosystems a crime.

title: ‘Gentle, brave, silly’: American killed in West Bank remembered by loved ones
content: Aysenur Eygi, a 26-year-old Turkish American, was killed while protesting a Jewish settlement expansion in the West Bank. She graduated from the University of Washington in June.
summary: Aysenur Eygi, a 26-year-old Turkish American, was killed while protesting a Jewish settlement expansion in the West Bank. She graduated from the University of Washington in June.

title: Palestinians honor U.S. activist killed in West Bank at memorial procession
content: Aysenur Eygi was killed at a protest in the West Bank. The closure of West Bank-Jordan land crossings has complicated efforts to repatriate her body to Turkey.
summary: Aysenur Eygi was killed at a protest in the West Bank. The closure of West Bank-Jordan land crossings has complicated efforts to repatriate her body to Turkey.

title: Princess Kate says she has finished cancer chemo treatment
content: Catherine, largely out of the public eye since Christmas, said she was “looking forward to being back at work and undertaking a few more public engagements in the coming months when I can.”
summary: Catherine, largely out of the public eye since Christmas, said she was “looking forward to being back at work and undertaking a few more public engagements in the coming months when I can.”

title: In Ukraine’s Poltava, soldier buries a father he thought safe from war
content: One of the deadliest single bombardments of the war left dozens of victims to be buried more than 100 miles from the front lines.
summary: One of the deadliest single bombardments of the war left dozens of victims to be buried more than 100 miles from the front lines.

title: Videos from Sudan’s killing fields reveal ethnic hatred behind massacres
content: Sudan’s Darfur region was the scene of a genocide two decades ago. Exclusive videos shared with The Post show the inflamed bigotry behind a new wave of killings.
summary: Sudan’s Darfur region was the scene of a genocide two decades ago. Exclusive videos shared with The Post show the inflamed bigotry behind a new wave of killings.

title: Israeli snipers again face scrutiny after death of civilian
content: Witnesses say the Israel Defense Forces fatally shot Aysenur Eygi, a 26-year-old American volunteer in the West Bank. The IDF said it was “looking into reports that a foreign national was killed as a result of shots fired in the area.”
summary: Witnesses say the Israel Defense Forces fatally shot Aysenur Eygi, a 26-year-old American volunteer in the West Bank. The IDF said it was “looking into reports that a foreign national was killed as a result of shots fired in the area.”

title: Edmundo González, likely winner of Venezuela election, flees to Spain
content: González fled days after the attorney general for Venezuela’s authoritarian president, Nicolás Maduro, filed a warrant for the arrest of the former diplomat.
summary: González fled days after the attorney general for Venezuela’s authoritarian president, Nicolás Maduro, filed a warrant for the arrest of the former diplomat.
